meanings.definition: A person who held a job or office before the current holder.
meanings.sent1: My predecessor at work trained me well.
meanings.sent2: The new manager is more efficient than his predecessor.
meanings.sent3: I always joke that my predecessor left behind a hidden treasure in the office.
meanings.sent4: Her predecessor's legacy loomed large over the company.
meanings.sent5: The footsteps of my predecessor echoed in the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: Something that comes before something else in time or in a series.
meanings.sent1: The typewriter was the predecessor of the modern computer.
meanings.sent2: The flip phone was the predecessor to the smartphone.
meanings.sent3: The ancient scroll could be considered the predecessor of the e-book.
meanings.sent4: The first draft of the novel served as the predecessor to the final version.
meanings.sent5: The black-and-white TV was the predecessor of the color television we have today.
